story.title: Running From Him - Episode 8
story.storyDescription: Avery has a secret that she’s hiding from her handsome new boss, Ethan. She doesn’t realize that Ethan has a secret of his own.
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Zoey Hughes lives in Seattle, where she enjoys writing, reading and watching bad reality TV.

story.prePaywallNotification: Avery and Ethan share a night of passion, but trouble lies ahead in RUNNING FROM HIM.
story.postPaywallNotification: Can Ethan help Avery escape the fury of her ex-boyfriend? Keep reading RUNNING FROM HIM.

messages.text: The next morning, Avery is naked, wrapped up in Ethan’s sheets.
A soft smile is on her lips as she awakens.
She turns over, her hands sliding across the bed in search of Ethan.
But the sheets are cold.
The light streams through the window and the bed is empty.
She’s on her feet when Ethan enters the room.
We have a problem.
What?
Ethan holds out his iPad.
It’s lit up with a popular gossip website.
Avery reads the headline out loud.
America’s Lost Son Spotted in Oregon.
The picture is from yesterday, at the hardware store.
Ethan and Avery are standing side by side.
Ethan’s pointing at a light fixture.
And Avery’s face is in plain view.
Fuck.
FUCK.
She thrusts the iPad at him and whirls around, looking for her clothes.
Luke is going to see that.
He’s going to know where I am.
Avery.
He’s going to find me.
What am I going to do?!
Avery! Calm down, okay?
You’re safe here with me.
Avery spins back around and looks at him, her eyes wild.
He has a GUN, Ethan.
And I bet he figured out how to use it — after last time.
I just came back from a war zone. I think I can handle him.
Avery sinks to the bed.
Avery reaches for the iPad, and reads the article out loud.
America’s lost son, Ethan Buchannon, has returned.
After years as a Page 6 fixture, and once engaged to a British socialite—
Avery glances up at Ethan.
That wasn’t true. We got photographed at a party together.
It was the first time we’d met.
Avery resumes reading.
Buchannon disappeared from the limelight following the death of his close friend.
Ethan scoffs.
Yeah. Close friend.
That’s what she’s reduced to, because she wasn’t from old money.
Avery goes back to reading the article.
The heir apparent has surfaced in Cedar Cove, Oregon.
He’s purchased a local bar, and is apparently content to live out a quiet life, far from the hub of his family’s billion-dollar-company.
I’m so screwed.
I know. This is the only bar in town.
They’re going to find me, and then they’ll find you.
Avery gives him back the iPad, her hand shaking.
So what do we do now?
I already called a military buddy. He lives up near Astoria.
I trusted him with my life overseas, and I’d trust him with yours.
It’s only a couple hours north, and you’ll be safe there.
I’m not leaving.
Just for now. I’ll stay here and let the storm roll in.
Once things die down—
I’m NOT leaving.
He’s going to find you, Avery.
But you said you can protect me.
And I will. But if he’s as dangerous as you say—
He is.
I’ve spent so long running.
And I finally feel secure, around you.
Please don’t send me away.
Avery stands, turning until she’s eye to eye with Ethan.
Please. You make me feel safe. I don’t want to go.
Ethan wraps her in his arms.
Okay. But don’t leave this building without me.
I’ll call a security company and get a system installed.
And then I’ll call my buddy.
He hasn’t picked up a job yet. He can keep an eye out at night.
Thank you.
I don’t know how I got lucky enough to walk into this…
…This thing with you, but I owe you my life.
Sometimes I think it’s the other way around.
They kiss for a long time.
Later that day, Avery is putting together dinner in the apartment while Ethan takes a shower.
She finds a bottle of wine but can’t find a corkscrew.
She goes downstairs to the bar to find one, taking the steps two at a time.
As she steps into the bar space, a shadow falls across the floor.
She looks over toward the doorway.
Hello, Avery.
